str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Really, truly, actually. Adverb of the oblique cases of on; really.
Feminine of a presumed derivative apparently from the base of chasma through the idea of deficiency; a widow, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To leave alone (solitary), forsake. From monos; to isolate, i.e. Bereave.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and meno; to stay further, i.e. Remain in a place, with a person; figuratively, to adhere to, persevere in.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Supplication, prayer, entreaty. From deomai; a petition.
From proseuchomai; prayer; by implication, an oratory.
